name: Aldo Nova
description: '''Aldo Nova''' is the stage name of '''Aldo Caporuscio''' (born November 13, 1956), a Canadian [[hard rock]] musician and [[music producer]]. He is a guitarist, keyboardist, and vocalist. He gained recognition with his 1982 debut album ''[[Aldo Nova (album)|Aldo Nova]]'', which peaked at ''Billboard''{{'s}} number 8 position, and its accompanying single, "[[Fantasy (Aldo Nova song)|Fantasy]]", which reached number 23 on the US [[Billboard Hot 100|'' Billboard'' Hot 100]] and boosted sales for its parent album. In 1997, he won a [[Grammy Award for Album of the Year]] as co-producer of Celine Dion's 1996 album ''[[Falling into You]]''. He co-wrote four songs on the  2000 album [[Uno (La Ley album)|''Uno'']] by [[La Ley (band)|La Ley]], which won the [[Grammy Award for Best Latin Rock or Alternative Album]].
